title: NewAmerica.org Help in the Interim and Email Accounts after You Leave
html:
Dear New Americans,

NEWAMERICA.ORG - Help in the Interim

A few updates on the website:

  • Reminder: please share the web developer posting with your friends!
  • While we work to fill that, and in an effort to make sure that we coordinate on website requests, please send all needs/challenges on things related to the website to webteam@newamerica.org. This will go to Fuzz, Gina, Evan, Erika, and Georgia. If you need help with your website permissions, posting a blog, creating a page, posting an event, adding a new bio, please email there so that we can make sure the right people are looking at the issue. This system is already working pretty well.
  • We have a new outside firm working to make some of the larger fixes we know are overdue. For instance, search is on the way, this time for realz. And more features will start to roll out after that.
  • Expect more improvements over the summer, including a new front page, back-end improvements, and some more ambitious stuff we're cooking up now.

What Happens to my Email Account if I Leave New America?

While we'll love you forever, we're trying to rein in the number of New America email accounts that are being used by former employees and fellows. It's just good practice and helps keep us more secure. As such, we are now going to disable a newamerica.org email 30 days after a person's last day with us. 30 days gives you time to establish another email account, notify your contacts, and otherwise transition.

If you have items of urgent importance that you would like to include in the next bi-weekly issue of READ-ME!, please send them to Terry Murphy at murphy@newamerica.org.

Best,

title: Performance Reviews, Diversity Report, and Bimonthly Column
html:
Hello, all

Performance Reviews are Coming!

Just a reminder that it is that time of year again… performance reviews will take place from May 26 through June 23. Keep an eye out for further information from your manager. Along with the Performance Reviews, you'll soon be receiving an email from Lisa Watson with the updated 'salary bands,' which flowed from the compensation study. These salary bands (and there will be more explanation in the email from Lisa) reflect the pay range for a selection of titles here at New America. Reminder that these are just guidelines and should not be construed as "wait, I only get..." or "what the- how come they make?" but they are ranges that you and your manager can use to guide your career progression, because the salary ranges and title match a set of criteria that reflect levels of responsibility.

Diversity Report

Keep an eye on your inboxes – next week we’ll be releasing the Diversity Task Force’s Action Plan. The task force discussed in depth the issues you surfaced in your survey responses, and has provided a set of recommendations to begin addressing some of the equity issues at New America.

Announcing A New America…

As astute readers of the Wonk will know, I will now be writing a bimonthly column called A New America (or perhaps Toward a New America). We hope it will get picked up periodically for syndication, so this is a great chance for me to amplify the work all of you are doing that is steadily building a new America. To make this more than just my musings, I will want data, examples, stories. Please send me your thoughts as to what would make a good column, although know that I am then quite likely to ask you to help me flesh it out!

Website—Follow-up on the May 15 Staff-Wide Email

  • NewAmerica.net is now forwarding over to NewAmerica.org, and we're working on migrating content. The developers expect this should go quickly. At the moment if there are things that aren't accessible that are crucial, let us know and we can move them manually.
  • The new developer team is working on integrating search into the website so that it's easier to find stuff, and starting on fixing bugs in both the editor and on the website.

If you have items of urgent importance that you would like to include in the next bi-weekly issue of READ-ME!, please send them to Terry Murphy at murphy@newamerica.org.

Best,

AM

title: Old Friends with New Responsibilities, the Move, and Events in October
html:
Hello, all:

Announcing Old Friends with New Duties…Stop by to say congratulations!

  • Kevin Bankston, Bankston@opentechinstitute.org, Director, Open Technology Institute. With the departure of Alan Davidson, Kevin is assuming the chief leadership role at OTI—working in the public interest to promote policy and regulatory reforms to strengthen communities by supporting open communications networks, platforms, and technologies. Previously, he was director of the OTI policy team. In his new capacity, Kevin will be joining the New America Leadership Team.
  • Georgia Bullen, georgia@opentechinstitute.org, Technology Project Manager, Open Technology Institute. As Technology Project Manager, Georgia will be assisting Kevin in managing the day-to-day operations of OTI's technology-related projects such as Measurement Lab, Commotion Wireless, data visualization projects and more. The TPM will ensure that all technology projects have what they need to achieve objectives.
  • Fuzz Hogan, fuzz@newamerica.org, Managing Editor. Fuzz oversees the Editorial, Events and Communications Department. In that role, he is primarily responsible for how we engage audiences in DC and beyond, supervising the EEC staff, and coordinating the work of each program's communications efforts. Editorial creates and curates widely syndicated content to support the policy goals of the programs and build the New America brand as a civic enterprise with "journalism in its DNA." Events engage the most influential people in media and policy through more than 200 live events a year, including the annual conference. Communications drives our efforts to place our experts in media, and engage our core audiences directly, while also supporting the communications needs of the organization. Fuzz is a member of the Leadership Team.

The Move and Events in October

An early advisory that the move to our fabulous new space means we can NOT host events in our current space or our new space in October. Our crack events staff is working with our many friends and partners to identify some smart spaces for us to use, so we will be able to continue our awesome events. But we wanted to give you a head’s up, so if you're planning to put on events in October you can plan ahead!

NYC: New Events and Office Space

In NYC, we are now hosting a majority of our events at Civic Hall, where New America is a founding partner. Beginning July 1, we will exclusively host events at Civic Hall or external venues, and bid a fond farewell to the Lafayette St. events space. We are also moving forward with a new office space a block from Civic Hall and are slated to complete a move-in by late July-early August. Further questions can be directed to Tyler Bugg at bugg@newamerica.org.

Welcome to our New Hires!

A warm welcome to Kim Dancy and Alison Yost! Their emails and bios are below. Drop them a line to say hello!

  • Kim Dancy, dancy@newamerica.org, Policy Analyst, Education Policy Program
  • Alison Yost, yost@newamerica.org, Communications Manager, Open Technology Institute

Offer of the Summer! Mark your Calendars for two exciting Development Professional Development talks.

  • Monday, June 22 at 4pm. Come hear David Callahan, founder of Inside Philanthropy, talk about his May 30 NYT piece,Who Will Watch the Charities?. David is a friend of Mark Schmitt's and a prolific writer and speaker on the world of philanthropy. He designed and built Inside Philanthropy (New America subscribes) to meet the challenges nonprofits routinely face in raising money, offering a more nuanced, inside understanding of funders. Please read the article in advance - it will offer a great primer for an interesting conversation.
  • Tuesday, June 23 at 4pm. Proposal Writing: A Conversation with Ed and OTI. Come here Conor Williams from Education Policy and Sarah Morris from OTI talk about grant writing and how they work their way through the proposal writing process. Learn some tips on project creation, narrative writing, collaborative writing, and herding the cats. Each brings a unique perspective - Conor offers a "I'm new to the process" perspective and Sarah offers some "been there/done that" tips.

title: A Couple of Important Updates on the Website and IT
html:
Hello, all:

A Couple of Important Updates on the Website & IT, From Your Friends on the IT Committee

  • Progress is being made on the website, though it was set back by a hack of the old site. Expect an announcement in the next couple of weeks that we have moved all the content from the old site to the new one. From there, the new contractors can implement search, SSL and making other important improvements. It will be a busy summer for the website.
  • We're quality checking content migration from the old site to the new site. A few of you are already helping with that, but if you are available to lend your eyes to check content, please let Georgia know, and she'll loop you in on what to do!
  • Updating our request from a couple weeks ago, please send any web, IT or Tech Support questions to techsupport@newamerica.org. There may come a day when we break it back out by tasks, but right now there’s enough connection between tech, IT and web that we should triage these needs together. (Note: Fuzz is on vacation until June 29th, so it's especially imperative that you email this alias and not him.)
  • We are also working to replace the Cyrus/Web Lead position, and making plans to onboard temporary help asap. If you know any qualified candidates, please share the job description with them! We have had surprisingly few applicants, and the few who did apply didn't have the right qualifications.
  • The IT team is conducting a full audit on current websites to make sure software and hosting versions are up to date to prevent security risk. We’ve found a lot of old offshoot sites that are such a security risk. We need to bring all of those ‘home.’ To that end, please coordinate with Erika/IT before you purchase any new website URLs or domains.

Related to Above, a Note About New America Bios…

In an attempt to minimize the number of people editing the website bio page—and to make sure all bios have gone through the same editing process—please send all requests for any new website bio postings, removals, or edits to Terry Murphy at murphy@newamerica.org.

READ-ME! on Hiatus Week of the Fourth of July

The next bi-weekly issue of READ-ME! would normally be sent on Monday, July 6. However, since that is such a popular vacation week, READ-ME! will be on hiatus that week. The next issue will be sent on July 13.

And have a Happy Fourth of July!

If you have items of urgent importance that you would like to include in the next bi-weekly issue of READ-ME!, please send them to Terry Murphy at murphy@newamerica.org.

title: Diversity Task Force Action Plan Now Posted on the Intranet
html:
Dear all,

Diversity Task Force Action Plan Now Posted on the Intranet

Last November I created the New America Diversity Task Force "to address, in a focused, proactive and practical way, the diversity issues that persist in our work environment." The task force has done so in developing the action plan I hereby share with you all. The New America Diversity Task Force Action Plan is now posted on the Intranet. I strongly urge each of you to read the plan carefully. It is not just about some of us but about all of us. It is about the kind of individuals and the kind of community we want to be. title: my.newamerica.org, Reserving Rooms in the New Office, PTO Accruals, and Recording your Wins
html:
Dear All,

my.newamerica.org and our Move FAQ

We have a new Intranet: my.newamerica.org! Any user with a valid New America or OTI Google account can log in. No separate Intranet password is required. My New America includes an FAQ section about our move to 740 15th Street. This page includes a move calendar, important information about what you need to be doing to prepare for the move, and it answers many common questions about what's going on. My New America also includes the following features:

  • Quick links to ADP, Salesforce, and Jazz on its homepage.
  • Searchable Staff Directory
  • Archives of Weekly Wins and Read-Me
  • Floor plans of our new DC office space.
  • Development, IT, Finance, TDM, and Payroll & Taxes resources, as well as general New America policies and organizational information.

Reserving Rooms in the New Office Space

Conference rooms in our new office space at 740 15th Street can now be reserved on Google Calendar. When creating an event, select "Rooms, etc" on the right of the Google Calendar screen. Rooms are organized into folders for the 8th, 9th, 10th, and 11th floors. Each available conference room is labeled as follows:

Floor Number - Room Size - Location

e.g. 10-Medium-Southeast

The Intranet's Floor Plans page shows where each conference room is located at 740 15th Street.

PTO Accruals

It has come to TDM’s attention that the PTO accruals in ADP for a small number of employees were not accurate. TDM has reviewed everyone's balances and will be reaching out to those affected by the end of the week. (The balances of affected employees have been updated in ADP as of 9/25/2015.) There is no need for alarm—we have ensured that everyone’s balances are completely right and adjusted any that are not. Please also keep in mind that you do not have to wait to accrue PTO before you use it. As a reminder, employees in their first year of employment have 4 weeks of PTO. Employees beyond their first year with NA have 6 weeks of PTO.

Recording your Wins

We're switching to a new system for recording and analyzing our 'impact' -- and we need everyone's help. Whenever your work has some kind of impact -- whether it has influenced policy or legislation, generated media coverage, been cited in research or a book, or appeared in a prominent social media feed -- submit your 'win' to wins@newamerica.org. This is the new 'presshits' inbox. It's the single feed from which we'll compile Weekly Wins, add content to In The News on our website, and store long-term records on Salesforce. When you're submitting your wins, please also remember, whenever possible, to include a 1-2 sentence description. It should be written exactly how you'd like to see your win recorded in Weekly Wins. For example: “John Smith's policy paper, "My Policy Paper", was quoted in The New York Times on the impact of the GOP primaries on dairy farms in Nebraska.”

TV Monitors

As you know, the big move is coming up on November 2. Unfortunately, the AV vendor will be moving all the big TV monitors in each of the conference rooms during the week of October 5. As a work-around, IT will be setting up large monitors and PCs within each conference room. Phones will still be intact until October 28. If you have any questions or concerns, please contact techsupport@newamerica.org.
